info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 5:25PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Pickens County through 600 PM EDT... At 525 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Pickens, or near Table Rock State Park, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pickens, Table Rock State Park, Jocassee Gorges, Sunset, Pumpkintown, Sassafras Mountain, Nine Times, Rocky Bottom and Dacusville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
